title: Southeast Asia: Malaysia and Singapore
brief_description: Most of the people in Malaysia are farmers, fishermen or miners. Most of the people of Singapore are merchants, importers and exporters, or factory workers. In both countries most of the people are Malay, Chinese, Indian and Pakistani. But in spite of the ethnic similarities, Malaysia and Singapore are strikingly different.
